title: How to Make Lenticular Prints With Photoshop

steps.title: Arrange a scene such that the main object is about 4-feet from the camera with some objects at the front and some at the back.
steps.content: Arrange a scene such that the main object is about 4-feet from the camera with some objects at the front and some at the back.

steps.title: Use the slider bar or a moving die-cast model car to take 9 consecutive pictures from left to right.
steps.content: Use the slider bar or a moving die-cast model car to take 9 consecutive pictures from left to right. Each picture should be about 0.4-in apart.

steps.title: Load the pictures into Adobe Photoshop on different layers of the same file with the first picture at the very bottom.
steps.content: Load the pictures into Adobe Photoshop on different layers of the same file with the first picture at the very bottom.

steps.title: Resize the image size to 720 dpi and about the width of your vertical lined lenticular sheet.
steps.content: Resize the image size to 720 dpi and about the width of your vertical lined lenticular sheet.

steps.title: Find a common point on all layers.
steps.content: Find a common point on all layers. Adjust the opacity of some layers and align the common point to the same x-y coordinates.

steps.title: Because of the alignment the top layer will be shifted to the right.
steps.content: Because of the alignment the top layer will be shifted to the right. Use the crop tool to crop out the empty space on the left.

steps.title: Create a new file called Mask about 36 pixel wider then the just cropped image.
steps.content: Create a new file called Mask about 36 pixel wider then the just cropped image.

steps.title: In the new file, draw a 2-pixel wide white vertical stripe, then a 16-pixel wide black stripe.
steps.content: In the new file, draw a 2-pixel wide white vertical stripe, then a 16-pixel wide black stripe. Fill the rest of the area with these white-black stripes.

steps.title: CTRL-A to select all the stripes; CTRL-C to copy them into the clipboard.
steps.content: CTRL-A to select all the stripes; CTRL-C to copy them into the clipboard.

steps.title: Create a layer mask for each layer on the original image.
steps.content: Create a layer mask for each layer on the original image.

steps.title: Select the bottom layer then click on the Channel tab.
steps.content: Select the bottom layer then click on the Channel tab. Highlight and select the Layer Mask layer and paste over the content of the clipboard.

steps.title: Click on the Layer tab and select the next layer up.
steps.content: Click on the Layer tab and select the next layer up.

steps.title: Go back to the Mask file.
steps.content: Go back to the Mask file. Move the whole pattern 2-pixels to the right. CTRL-A and CTRL-C to put the shifted content to the clipboard.

steps.title: Repeat step 11 for the working layer instead of the bottom layer.
steps.content: Repeat step 11 for the working layer instead of the bottom layer.

steps.title: Repeat the same steps for the other layers up.
steps.content: Repeat the same steps for the other layers up.

steps.title: Print the merged file at 720 dpi.
steps.content: Print the merged file at 720 dpi.

steps.title: Laminate the lenticular sheet over the top of the printout.
steps.content: Laminate the lenticular sheet over the top of the printout.
